intro: Coelospermum paniculatum var. paniculatum, commonly known as the panicled coelospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, with lance-shaped leaves and vibrant yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural collections.
